text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I just want to
show you the perfect way to roast garlic
now I have been having so many people
ask me how to roast garlic I use roasted
garlic in so many different things I
have a couple recipes and Laura in the
kitchen on how to use it I use it in my
for example my roasted garlic mashed
potatoes it's unbelievable I use in
salad dressings but I also just love it
on a little dish and then just drizzle a
little bit of olive oil on it and then
spread it on a piece of bread it's
delicious it it's just way when you
roast garlic it does not taste like
garlic it's so sweet it's almost nutty
so I just figured I would show you a
quick way to roast it perfectly every
single time so are you gonna need it's a
clove of garlic olive oil and salt now
here's what I do I take my whole head of
garlic just like that and I cut it right
down the middle same so all the garlic
cloves are exposed I then put it on a
piece of aluminum foil and you want to
make sure you pre-heat your oven to 400
at this point get that ready for you
drizzle it with a little bit of olive
oil sprinkle a little bit of salt you
could do pepper but you really don't
need to then just put it back together
as I feel like kind of reuniting the two
and tightly cover it in the aluminum
foil this means it's going to steam in
there and the garlic cloves are gonna
get really nice and soft and roast it
and I'll show you my absolute favorite
way to eat it but for now this is gonna
go into your premium Evan 400 degrees
for about 45 minutes to an hour or until
the cloves are incredibly soft and
golden brown my garlic roasted for about
45 minutes and I let it cool for about
ten minutes otherwise I would really
burn myself look at that oh they come
right out smells unbelievable you can
still see the steam and this is how one
of my absolutely favorite ways to eat
this once in a while my husband and I
instead of having like a big dinner we
love to have like the little appetizers
you know by the couch watching some
probably trashy TV
but this is one of the things we love
you just take a piece of this garlic
which it's just mirrors like butter
right and that's what I love to do I
love to just smear it on the piece of
baguette and you can use absolutely
Madhu two cloves you can use any bread
that you prefer spread it on like so and
at this point like I said it's not super
garlicky and bitter it's just sweet and
nutty and delicious and then I just
drizzle a touch of olive oil over the
top and some freshly cracked black
pepper and that's it mmm oh it's just so
good there are tons of different things
you can do with that but like I said
this is one my favorite ways hmm well
that's it you'll learn how to cook
garlic roast garlic perfectly every
single time now I'm gonna go enjoy this
with my husband and I'll see you next
time bye bye
